DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Tolerability Bilberry Extract Volunteers With Impaired Twilight Night Vision
DOC.criteria: Healthy subject ( volunteer ) agerelated impaired twilight night Age 50 70 , men woman Written inform consent Full visual acuity ( vision ≥ 0.7 ) accord DIN Standard condition Refraction ≤ +/6.0 high main step Agerelated finding ophthalmologic examination ( anterior chamber eye ground ) Normal intraocular pressure ( 1020 mmHg ) Diabetes mellitus Epilepsy Abnormal visual acuity eye ground ( e.g . cloud lens ) Age related vision problem Glaucoma macular degeneration Disease retina Consumption anthocyan preparation past six month Opthalmologic pathology : cataract , visus < 0.7 , retinal pathology , maculopathy , intraocular pressure ( > 21 mmHg ) , know acute chronic eye disease , use hard contact lenses , eye surgery perform within last 12 month Any serious disorder might interfere his/her participation study evaluation efficacy safety test drug : e.g . diabetes mellitus , anamnestic indication diabetic microangiopathy polyneuropathy , renal insufficiency , hepatic metabolic dysfunction , cardiovascular disease ( hypertension > 160/100 mmHg ) , psychiatric disorder , myasthenia gravis , delirious state , albino Any treatment might interfere evaluation test drug , particular drug know influence eye sight adaptation ( e.g . chloroquine , digitalis , ethambutol , chlorpromazine phenothiazine derivative thioridazine , periciazine , perphenazine ) Known hypersensitivity ingredient study drug Drug alcohol abuse Pregnancy , lactation , woman childbearing potential use establish contraceptive Participation another trial within past 30 day
